name: L'Enfant Plaza Hotel

reviews.text: Reservations were difficult because we were going with a group, but I was able to get them done. Flight landed at 8:00, got to the hotel at 8:30 and the dreaded, "Sorry Sir, we don't have the room you've requested" line. How a hotel does not have a clean room at 8:30 pm is beyond me. I was offered a complimentary dinner at the hotel, which was good and thankfully I did not need to pay for the overpriced menu.
reviews.title: What else could go wrong?

reviews.text: After dinner, 10:00 now, I made the walk of shame back to the counter and "I don't know why but the room I put on hold for you has been checked in by another guest". At least I was not alone, another meeting companion, also checking in around 8:00 was hearing the same lines.
reviews.title: Perfect Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When I finally got to my room (10:45) the floor was very wet in between the beds. I crashed and in the morning I informed the front desk of the situation. They assured me that it would be dried and taken care of. Of course, by the time I got back, it was not changed.
reviews.title: Location Location Location

likes.liked: — location - access to the Metro - hotel accommodations (restaurants, shops on premises)
likes.disliked: — shabbiness of parts of the room itself... it needed some work.

reviews.text: All this aside, here's what I thought:
reviews.title: Nice deal at L'Enfant Plaza Hotel

likes.disliked: — Lack of stores opened on weekend

reviews.title: Average, not worth the price
reviews.text: Pros: Location is great, staff were friendly despite my challenges.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Property in bad need of update. I stayed there 25 years ago and I don't think they have done a thing to it since. Shower did not drain properly and it never got fixed in the 5 days we were there. It is supposed to be a non smoking facility but they were smoking in the courtyard which is supposed to be smoke free and again when we told them about people continued to smoke in the area. On the day we checked out there was no hot water. Great location for the Mall and the Metro but there are no resturaunts within walking distance of the Hotel
reviews.title: tired and dated

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in room15-170 for the rate we were able to get, 147 per night, for a long weekend. Valet parking 30 per day. Metro under the hotel, very easy, after a walk through a crummy little mall. The room showed use everywhere. Cheap hotel furniture was knicked up, stains on upholstery, stains on carpet, torn lamp shades, bubbling wallpaper etc. The a/c is older and chugs out a constant moldy body odor and or pet smell. The bathroom was average, not quite 4star clean and also showed signs of wear with shower rods falling out and smashed up toilet seat bumpers. Poor complimentary toiletries. 4 star laundry service, everything clean, white and fresh smelling and of decent quality. Fee for internet was $9 a day, tacky. Lobby and lounges, dining all nice for a 3 star. Room service was above average, including service, selection, and quality/quantity vs price. We had no problems with any of the staff, all were polite and helpful, in fact they mailed us our bathroom bag after we had gotten home to CT free of charge, which I thought was pretty dang hospitable. The immediate location, grounds, seemed very safe and clean, close to the mall, and of course it's on a Metro transfer. However the location is kind of 'free standing', there is not much immediately around the hotel for entertainment, you would have to venture out a ways to eat, drink and find Mary. If everything were updated / repaired better I'd stay again if I were looking for a quick and cheap 3 or so star place, but not if the prices went much higher. (I'd rather stay elsewhere.)
reviews.title: Good rate, easy Metro, dated / used slightly above average room

likes.liked: — Location, price per night, could be better than a basic 3 Star
likes.disliked: — Location, lame maintenance dept, housekeeping not getting the corners nooks and cranies well, or often, enough

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here from 10/18 to 10/22. We booked with QuickBook for a rate of $139 for the weekend nights and $189 for the Thursday and Sunday nights. I had never used OuickBook before and liked the fact that there were no fees for booking through them.
reviews.title: Worked Out Well For Us

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room had a king sized bed and looked out over the pool area The pool is covered by a blow up bubble of sorts for the winter allowing for year round swimming. The bed was comfortable and had several nice feather pillows. There was plenty of drawer and closet space.
reviews.title: Check your mattress!
okay
reviews.text: We also had some curling of wallpaper in the bathroom. The wallpaper didn't look that old so maybe the glue was bad that they used? Otherwise all of the fixtures in the bathroom looked new and worked as they are suppose to. There was a coffee maker, hairdryer and tolietries provided.

reviews.title: Terrible Hotel, Didn't Even Stay!!!!!
reviews.text: Let me start off by saying, DO NOT STAY HERE. We had read a lot of the reviews and after going back and forth with this hotel and anotehr, decided to stay here for the convenience, BIG MISTAKE. We arrived on 12/22/07 with a written confirmation from the hotel for a "Dlx King Connect Parlor" room...when we got there, we were informed by the manager on duty that those types of rooms don't even exist at this hotel. We also told her that we had spoken to one of her staff before coming down, and he said nothing about that type of room not existing and also "promised" us a room with a view as the hotel was not full that weekend everyone would get that type of room. We did give the manager the name of the staff that we spoke to, and again, she appologized. She offered us either a regular king room with a "view" or a larger king room with a couch, but no "view." We asked about a "suite" and were told that they don't give those types of rooms away for the $99 per night price we were paying, as they go for $499 per night. The manager did appologize for the "inconvenience" but told us that we had to be willing to compromise. I asked how me chosing between two rooms, both of which were "lower" then what I had written confirmation for was a compromise given they were not doign anything to correct the situation, and was not given an answer. We chose the regular king room with a view and proceeded up to our room. The view was of the highway (very noisey). The room was NOT CLEAN at all. In the bathroom, there was hair all over the ceiling as well brown "stains" on the ceiling and on the floor. We went back down to the front desk and spoke to the same manager who once again appologized. She did give us coupons for one mornings breakfast. It was agreed that while we went out for a few hours, the staff would move our bags to a king room with a couch. We returned a few hours later and went to our new room, and again, it was NOT CLEAN. Again there was hair all over the bathroom, on the bed, and there were rusty nails coming our of the walls. We called down to the front desk and the same manager said she would call us back a few minutes later, which she did and said they would "touch up" our original room and make sure it was clean for us to move back to it. We decided enough was enough and went to stay at the Embassy Suites on 22nd St which was AMAZING. Given nothing that L'enfant Plaza said was true, I made sure to get in writing from them that I would not be charged anything for leaving early, and they gave that to me. In our taxi ride over to the new hotel, our driver was saying how he had heard that L'Enfant Plaza had lost a lot of staff, and was not as "good" as it had been in the past. When we returned home on 12.26.07 I called L'Enfant Plaza and asked to talk to the general manager, who I was told was away until 12.30.07. I left a voice mail message for him and have not heard back as of 1.2.08. I did however get a generic email from the hotel saying they joped my stay was pleasant and that I would come back again. ARE THEY KIDDING??????

reviews.title: very nice, good price
reviews.text: First I'll tell you the good points about this hotel. This is the closest hotel to the smithsonian. We walked everywhere with our 8 year old and he did fine. This hotel has a great indoor pool. It was really large and the kids had a ball at the end of the day, it does close at 8pm, so take note. The rooms were very spacious, we had a rollaway ($20 a night) and it wasn't cramped a bit. The beds were very comfortable with a down comforter. The toiletries were Rusk products, very nice. the lobby was really nice. The staff was very nice.

reviews.title: great hotel for a good price
reviews.text: Bad points. It is an older hotel that has not been 100% kept up. Yes, you can see wallpaper tears here and there. Tile cracks here and there. It's not terrible. Also, there are no restaurants in the area. There is a food court underneath the hotel, but it's closed by around 6pm.

While the hotel did have some upkeep issues, I'm really picky and it didn't bother me. The hotel was very clean, the carpet and floors were all clean, everything smelled clean. The bathroom had a lot of marble, the bedding was new and tasteful.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

likes.liked: — The Metro Station in the basement

reviews.title: Enjoyed my stay
reviews.text: We only paid $99 a night which included valet parking.

OK Good location, Metro eazy on and off, But there it ends, We were first given a room on the back side of the hotel and told about construction that would last till 8:30 PM, I thought it was out side but it was on the roof, The pounding and drill was unreal! We had alos asked to two Queen Beds, We got two double beds! We were moved to the river side of the building great view of the river but the traffic could be heard all night but the clerk who moved us told us that and I did say no problem, It was better than the drilling. The room both room were need updating, The stop on the sink was broken, the shower head was coming off. It was a cold night and it came thru the glass doors, I do have to say the Housekeeping staff and the front door guys was very helpful and pleasant. The Rate did incluled parking which can be $28 to $35 in places.
reviews.title: Good location ..BUT

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we travel for a 2 night getaway, we are mostly concerned with cleanliness, responsive staff, location and safety. As previous posts mentioned, yes, the decor is very dated and could really use a face lift, but we knew this going in, and it did not detract from our experience. Overall, the L'Enfant Plaza hotel really helped to make our recent trip to DC a very memorable experience, and we do recommend this hotel. We were able to secure a great online deal for $99 a night, which included free valet parking (normally $30 a day). Here is a run down of what we encountered:
reviews.title: Very good getaway

likes.liked: — The staff. Fastest check-in i have ever experienced.

reviews.text: Positives:
reviews.title: location, location, location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1.Great location. Just a few blocks from wonderful museums and attractions
reviews.title: The LEnfant is in a perfect location

likes.disliked: — lack of area places to eat/drink

reviews.text: 2.The metro is underneath the hotel, as are some mall shops.
reviews.title: We were very pleased with our stay!!

reviews.text: The L'Enfant Plaza is walking distance to many major sites in DC. If your destination is more of a walk than you'd care to attempt, however, there is a Metro stop in the basement. The area right around
reviews.title: Great Location,big rooms,big price tag

likes.disliked: — Extra charges (internet, parking) poor quality soap and shampoo

reviews.text: the hotel is a virtual ghost town after the end of the workday, which
reviews.title: Wouldn't do this again

likes.liked: — its proximity to the locat attractions and public transporation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: was disconcerting to me, but we saw no suspicious characters. I disliked paying almost $200 for a room and then having parking fees tacked on. The valet parking was $15 by internet, and $30 if booked by the hotel.
reviews.title: It was OK

reviews.text: I found the rooms decent, large, and nothing special. The
reviews.title: Loved this hotel!

reviews.text: complementary toiletries were very poor- bring your own soap and shampoo. The hotel charges for internet access.
reviews.title: Don't stay here

likes.liked: — There was a balcony...and fresh (though hot & humid) air
likes.disliked: — The high noise level, the poor food, and the small bed

reviews.text: we arrived about 2:00pm. check-in time is 3 so weren't surprised that our rooms weren't ready. the front desk clerk said the room would be ready "around 3 or later." it ended up being 3:45 without an apology. we decided to go downstairs to the promanade to get something to eat. word of advise: do not eat at the buffet style place there. stick with mcdonalds.
reviews.title: better than i thought it was going to be

likes.disliked: — feel like your in the middle of nowhere once the sun goes down

reviews.text: once in our rooms we were pleasantly surprised. clean (with the exception of the air vent), spacious, and the beds were comfortable. housekeeping staff--outstanding.
reviews.title: Run Away Fast!

likes.disliked: — Complete disregard for the customer - as if a jackhammer is normal hotel elevator musak

reviews.text: i would suggest getting a room on the 12th floor because the patio door opens right into the pool area. there are chairs and a table outside the room. it was nice to sit outside and have coffee in the morning.
reviews.title: Great Location for a family trip to DC

reviews.text: the maine street fish market is down the street. we ate at an asian fusion kind of restaurant there called "jenny's". the food was excellent. also ate at a seafood buffet place there called phillips flagship. the selection was huge although the food was not the best in the world. they have a huge patio that overlooks the water. it has a kind of san francisco feel.
reviews.title: AVOID this HOTEL

reviews.text: get a metro guide from the front desk and study it before going out. smithsonian is only one stop up from the hotel.
reviews.title: Pricey for this low quality hotel

likes.liked: — breakfast buffet, metro and many shops below hotel
likes.disliked: — staff unresponsive to RESOLVING room problems, not just apologies

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We only stayed one night on a Saturday. We must have got a great deal as I am
reviews.title: Great room-Not so quiet at times

likes.liked: — Close to attraction, comfy bed, clean
likes.disliked: — Catering to a group and ignoring other paying guests

reviews.text: reading the reviews or maybe it was the time of year. We paid $133 for the night
reviews.title: Good outweighs the bad

reviews.text: and that included 24 hours of valet parking.
reviews.title: Great Staff, Good Service, Average Accomodations

reviews.text: Very impressed with the friendly, helpful staff. They are very knowledgeable
reviews.title: Good Location and Good for Kids
Horrible!!!
reviews.text: about the city and were very helpful in getting around.

reviews.title: So bad I changed hotels
reviews.text: I was at the L'Enfant Hotel for a meeting; it was supposed to be for 3 nights but I left after one (it wouldn't even have been this long if I hadn't got in late).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There must be a range of room quality here .....and I got the bottom of the range. My first room was on the inside corner; it was very dark and I didn't want to share a balcony with the room on the other side of the corner. I asked for another room, preferably on the outside. I was told by the front desk that those rooms are all noisy and they reluctantly gave me another room.
reviews.title: Great Location, About right for the price.

likes.liked: — The proximity to L'Enfant Plaza Metro station.

reviews.text: What a mistake. The carpet was dirty, the toilet bowl was oval but the seat was round and there was no cover. Net result, the edge of the toilet bowl is always exposed. There was still an open gouge in the ceiling at the tub where a door had been taken off and replaced by a shower curtain on a rod. The air conditioner only had one speed that worked (thankfully it was the low setting) but when it ran, there was a constant loud clicking noise and .....it leaked. The Unit was set in the ceiling so the carpet underneath was wet and moldy smelling. There was something under the wall-to-wall carpet in several areas; it went from one side of the room to another and looked like it was an electrical cord. I sure hope there aren't wires under the carpet. The closet sliding doors screamed/screeched every time they were moved and the room door stood open whenever it was opened.
reviews.title: L'Enfant Plaza Hotel is Perfect!!

likes.liked: — I liked how the staff was so willing to help out and accomodate every need we had!!!
likes.disliked: — The air conditioning in the room was hard to control, but it was never a problem.

reviews.text: I complained when I checked out and the only response was there would be a $50 fee for an early departure.
reviews.title: Great Value

reviews.text: A dump I will not return to.....and I'm in this city 2-3 times a month.
reviews.title: great value

description: A homey and comfortable hotel within walking distance of major attractions.
